elements.content: The solvent-dependent double-stranded one-dimensional (1-D) coordination polymer [Ag2 L 2(ClO4)2] n (1) and another 1-D polymer {[Ag2 L 2(CH3CN)]·2ClO4} n (2a) with the shape of a cut of tube along the long axis were obtained in the reactions of a 16-membered O2S2-macrocycle L with silver(I) perchlorate in DCM/MeOH and CH3CN, respectively. Time-dependent crystallization experiments unambiguously show that 2a is a kinetic product and transforms into a thermodynamically more stable [AgLClO4] n (2b) with a two-dimensional square-grid structure.
elements.clean_text: The solvent-dependent double-stranded one-dimensional (1-D) coordination polymer [Ag2 L 2(ClO4)2] n  (1) and another 1-D polymer {[Ag2 L 2(CH3CN)]⋅2ClO4} n  (2a) with the shape of a cut of tube along the long axis were obtained in the reactions of a 16-membered O2S2-macrocycle L with silver(I) perchlorate in DCM/MeOH and CH3CN, respectively. Time-dependent crystallization experiments unambiguously show that 2a is a kinetic product and transforms into a thermodynamically more stable [AgLClO4] n  (2b) with a two-dimensional square-grid structure.

elements.content: The solvent-dependent one-dimensional coordination polymers [Ag2 L 2(ClO4)2] n (1) and {[Ag2 L 2(CH3CN)]·2ClO4} n (2a) were isolated from the reactions of an O2S2-macrocycle L with silver(I) perchlorate. Interestingly, the crystalline complex 2a transforms slowly to the thermodynamically more stable [AgLClO4] n (2b) with a two-dimensional square-grid structure.
elements.clean_text: The solvent-dependent one-dimensional coordination polymers [Ag2 L 2(ClO4)2] n  (1) and {[Ag2 L 2(CH3CN)]⋅2ClO4} n  (2a) were isolated from the reactions of an O2S2-macrocycle L with silver(I) perchlorate. Interestingly, the crystalline complex 2a transforms slowly to the thermodynamically more stable [AgLClO4] n  (2b) with a two-dimensional square-grid structure.

elements.content: Coordination polymeric structures quite often display a remarkable dependence on the choice of noncoordinating anions and the type of coordinating and/or noncoordinating solvents. In practice, the coordinating solvents can influence the coordination geometry of the metal ions, while the noncoordinating solvents can induce different structural aggregates, and thus both effects are most likely to play an important role in crystal engineering. Hannon et al have reported a series of the anion- and/or solvent-dependent silver(I) complexes of thiomethyl-terpyridine which can be led by “chemical frustration”. Sometimes, metastable compounds can be formed as kinetic products in the beginning of such self-assembly and then transform into the thermodynamic product.
elements.clean_text: Coordination polymeric structures quite often display a remarkable dependence on the choice of noncoordinating anions and the type of coordinating and/or noncoordinating solvents. In practice, the coordinating solvents can influence the coordination geometry of the metal ions, while the noncoordinating solvents can induce different structural aggregates, and thus both effects are most likely to play an important role in crystal engineering. Hannon et al have reported a series of the anion- and/or solvent-dependent silver(I) complexes of thiomethyl-terpyridine which can be led by "chemical frustration". Sometimes, metastable compounds can be formed as kinetic products in the beginning of such self-assembly and then transform into the thermodynamic product.

elements.content: We have been interested in the assembly of supramolecular architectures based on the exocoordination of thiacrown system because the sulfur donor is expected to favor binding toward soft metal ions in an exocyclic mode. Ag(I) (d10) is a typical soft-metal ion that exhibits weaker stereochemical demands, often producing complex geometries dictated by the conformational preferences of the ligands than the geometric demands of the metal center. Recently, we have reported the anion-controlled endo- and exocyclic disilver(I) complexes of the O2S2-macrocycle with AgPF6 and AgClO4, respectively. The coordination modes that provide the Ag(I) position inside or outside the macrocyclic cavity are explained by the anion-coordination ability toward the metal cation. Not only are we interested in investigating the factors that influence the self-assembly of metal complexes into distinct solvent-dependent products, but also we want to advance our understanding of a methodology of emerging significance in macrocyclic chemistry that may serve as a potent controllable phenomenon.
elements.clean_text: We have been interested in the assembly of supramolecular architectures based on the exocoordination of thiacrown system because the sulfur donor is expected to favor binding toward soft metal ions in an exocyclic mode. Ag(I) (d10) is a typical soft-metal ion that exhibits weaker stereochemical demands, often producing complex geometries dictated by the conformational preferences of the ligands than the geometric demands of the metal center. Recently, we have reported the anion-controlled endo- and exocyclic disilver(I) complexes of the O2S2-macrocycle with AgPF6 and AgClO4, respectively. The coordination modes that provide the Ag(I) position inside or outside the macrocyclic cavity are explained by the anion-coordination ability toward the metal cation. Not only are we interested in investigating the factors that influence the self-assembly of metal complexes into distinct solvent-dependent products, but also we want to advance our understanding of a methodology of emerging significance in macrocyclic chemistry that may serve as a potent controllable phenomenon.

elements.content: On the basis of these considerations, the proposed 16-membered dibenzo-macrocycle L employs two sulfur donors in the crown rings as a bridgehead for the required exocoordination-based-networking (Scheme ). When the silver(I) perchlorate is reacted with L, the reaction products 1 and 2a are dependent on the solvents used as depicted in Scheme . Briefly, the intriguing feature of the results in this study is the influence of solvent coordinating ability on the coordination environment and resulting polymeric structures. Another interesting aspect is the rearrangement of kinetic product 2a (one-dimensional, 1-D) into thermodynamic one 2b (two-dimensional, 2-D). Such coordinated-solvent induced rearrangement is rare in polymeric structures containing macrocyclic ligands.
elements.clean_text: On the basis of these considerations, the proposed 16-membered dibenzo-macrocycle L  employs two sulfur donors in the crown rings as a bridgehead for the required exocoordination-based-networking (Scheme ). When the silver(I) perchlorate is reacted with L, the reaction products 1 and 2a are dependent on the solvents used as depicted in Scheme . Briefly, the intriguing feature of the results in this study is the influence of solvent coordinating ability on the coordination environment and resulting polymeric structures. Another interesting aspect is the rearrangement of kinetic product 2a (one-dimensional, 1-D) into thermodynamic one 2b (two-dimensional, 2-D). Such coordinated-solvent induced rearrangement is rare in polymeric structures containing macrocyclic ligands.

elements.content:
<fig fig-type="scheme" id="sch1" orientation="portrait" position="float">
<label>1</label>
<graphic orientation="portrait" position="float" xlink:href="cg-2009-01335w_0001.tif"></graphic>
</fig>

L was synthesized as described previously by us. For complexation with silver(I) perchlorate, two solvent systems with different coordinating abilities were used. Initially, the reaction of L in dichloromethane with 1 equiv of AgClO4 in methanol gave colorless crystals exhibiting a double-stranded 1-D polymer with the formula [Ag2 L 2(ClO4)2] n (1), in which no solvent molecule is present in the coordination sphere (Figure ). The asymmetric unit of the neutral chain contains two L, two silver ions, and two perchlorate ions. Each macrocycle coordinates in a bidnetate fashion via two exodentate S donors, with the two ring oxygen donors remaining uncoordinated. Two of the Ag centers (Ag1 and Ag2) that lie outside the cavity have tetrahedral geometry but different coordination environments. For example, Ag1 is coordinated by two sulfur donors from two distinct ligands aligned along the chain (Ag1−S1 2.440, Ag1−S4 2.452 Å). Further, two such Ag1 atoms are bridged by two ClO4 − ions in a bidentate manner. Unlike Ag1 atom, Ag2 is coordinated by two sulfur donors from two different strands (Ag2−S2A 2.432, Ag2−S3 2.410 Å). Two Ag2 atoms are also doubly linked by two ClO4 − ions but in a monodentate manner. Thus, the alternating Ag1-(μ2-ClO4)2-Ag1 and Ag2-(μ-ClO4)2-Ag2 units are further linked through the macrocycles, resulting in a double-stranded 1-D polymer. The interligand π−π interaction between aromatic rings (dashed line, centroid-to-centroid distance 3.900 Å) along the chain also stabilizes the chain structure. The Ag···Ag distances are 4.367 Å for Ag1···Ag1A and 4.117 Å for Ag2···Ag2A. A limited number of the discrete and polymeric complexes exhibiting two Ag atoms linked with two monodentate or two bidentate perchlorate ions have been observed by us and others. To the best of our knowledge, 1 is the first characterized example of a disilver system bridged by two monodentate and two bidentate perchlorate ions, respectively. In this complex, the two types of chelating ClO4 − ions occupy most of the coordination sites of Ag(I) and probably prevent the solvent coordination from relatively weaker coordinating solvents (i.e., DCM/MeOH). For 1, the phase purity of the bulk material was confirmed by X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) ().
elements.clean_text: L was synthesized as described previously by us. For complexation with silver(I) perchlorate, two solvent systems with different coordinating abilities were used. Initially, the reaction of L in dichloromethane with 1 equiv of AgClO4 in methanol gave colorless crystals exhibiting a double-stranded 1-D polymer with the formula [Ag2 L 2(ClO4)2] n  (1), in which no solvent molecule is present in the coordination sphere (Figure ). The asymmetric unit of the neutral chain contains two L, two silver ions, and two perchlorate ions. Each macrocycle coordinates in a bidnetate fashion via two exodentate S donors, with the two ring oxygen donors remaining uncoordinated. Two of the Ag centers (Ag1 and Ag2) that lie outside the cavity have tetrahedral geometry but different coordination environments. For example, Ag1 is coordinated by two sulfur donors from two distinct ligands aligned along the chain (Ag1-S1 2.440, Ag1-S4 2.452 Å). Further, two such Ag1 atoms are bridged by two ClO4 - ions in a bidentate manner. Unlike Ag1 atom, Ag2 is coordinated by two sulfur donors from two different strands (Ag2-S2A 2.432, Ag2-S3 2.410 Å). Two Ag2 atoms are also doubly linked by two ClO4 - ions but in a monodentate manner. Thus, the alternating Ag1-(μ2-ClO4)2-Ag1 and Ag2-(μ-ClO4)2-Ag2 units are further linked through the macrocycles, resulting in a double-stranded 1-D polymer. The interligand π-π interaction between aromatic rings (dashed line, centroid-to-centroid distance 3.900 Å) along the chain also stabilizes the chain structure. The Ag⋅⋅⋅Ag distances are 4.367 Å for Ag1⋅⋅⋅Ag1A and 4.117 Å for Ag2⋅⋅⋅Ag2A. A limited number of the discrete and polymeric complexes exhibiting two Ag atoms linked with two monodentate or two bidentate perchlorate ions have been observed by us and others. To the best of our knowledge, 1 is the first characterized example of a disilver system bridged by two monodentate and two bidentate perchlorate ions, respectively. In this complex, the two types of chelating ClO4 - ions occupy most of the coordination sites of Ag(I) and probably prevent the solvent coordination from relatively weaker coordinating solvents (i.e., DCM/MeOH). For 1, the phase purity of the bulk material was confirmed by X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) ().

elements.content: Crystal structure of 1, [Ag2 L 2(ClO4)2] n showing the double-stranded 1-D arrangement.
elements.clean_text: 1  Crystal structure of 1, [Ag2 L 2(ClO4)2] n  showing the double-stranded 1-D arrangement.

elements.content: As mentioned above, when acetonitrile was used as a solvent instead of DCM/MeOH, the reaction of L with AgClO4 led to the formation of a 1-D polymeric product {[Ag2 L 2(CH3CN)](ClO4)2} n (2a), in which no anion is present in the coordination sphere (Figure ). The asymmetric unit contains two L, two silver atoms, and one coordinated acetonitrile molecule. Unlike that of 1, the coordination sphere in 2a has a solvent molecule instead of the anion to form a different type of 1-D network. In 2a, Ag1 is bonded to sulfur atoms from three different macrocycles and thus exhibits trigonal coordination geometry. However, the Ag2 center is four-coordinate, being bound to two S donors from two adjacent ligands and one acetonitrile, with macrocycle adopting an exoconformation. Interestingly, the coordination polyhedron of Ag2 is completed by one aromatic carbon atom (C7) from an adjacent L. The Ag2−C7 distance, 2.615 Å, is well within the reported limits (2.47−2.77 Å) for Ag-π coordination. The next closest contact between Ag and C is 2.910 Å for C8 (dashed line). Thus, the Ag2 atom can be described as a distorted tetrahedral structure. Accordingly, L acts as a ditopic ligand coordinating to two Ag atoms via two Ag−S bonds and another Ag atom via Ag-π coordination. With respect to the solvent used, the preferred solvent-coordinating species 2a is due to the higher coordinating ability of the acetonitrile for the soft Ag(I), allowing the approach of aromatic unit to form an extra bonding. Consequently, the difference of coordination abilities of solvents influences the coordination environment and bonding modes of the ligands resulting in different structural architectures. It is obvious that the coordination of acetonitrile plays an important role. According to the packing structure, the connectivity between Ag and sulfur atoms generated a 1-D polymeric structure which resembles that of a “cut of tube along the long axis” in the middle (Figure c). The approximate diameter of the “cut of tube along the long axis” is 10 Å (1 nm). The inside of the channel is filled with ClO4 − ions and one more ClO4 − ion per formula unit is also present outside the tube. Both anions have weak interactions with Ag1 (Ag1···O 3.01−3.06 Å) (Figure c). For 2a, the phase purity of the bulk material was also confirmed by XRPD ().

The asymmetric unit contains two L, two silver atoms, and one coordinated acetonitrile molecule. Unlike that of 1, the coordination sphere in 2a has a solvent molecule instead of the anion to form a different type of 1-D network. In 2a, Ag1 is bonded to sulfur atoms from three different macrocycles and thus exhibits trigonal coordination geometry. However, the Ag2 center is four-coordinate, being bound to two S donors from two adjacent ligands and one acetonitrile, with macrocycle adopting an exoconformation. The Ag2-C7 distance, 2.615 Å, is well within the reported limits (2.47-2.77 Å) for Ag-π coordination. The next closest contact between Ag and C is 2.910 Å for C8 (dashed line). Thus, the Ag2 atom can be described as a distorted tetrahedral structure. Consequently, the difference of coordination abilities of solvents influences the coordination environment and bonding modes of the ligands resulting in different structural architectures. It is obvious that the coordination of acetonitrile plays an important role. According to the packing structure, the connectivity between Ag and sulfur atoms generated a 1-D polymeric structure which resembles that of a "cut of tube along the long axis" in the middle (Figure c). The approximate diameter of the "cut of tube along the long axis" is 10 Å (1 nm). elements.content: Crystal structure of 2a, {[Ag2 L 2(CH3CN)](ClO4)2} n ; (a) asymmetric unit, (b) 1-D polymeric network, (c) cross section of “half-tube” like structure, and (d) packing arrangement.
elements.clean_text: 2  Crystal structure of 2a, {[Ag2 L 2(CH3CN)](ClO4)2} n ; (a) asymmetric unit, (b) 1-D polymeric network, (c) cross section of "half-tube" like structure, and (d) packing arrangement.

elements.content: Very interestingly, we found that the crystalline complex 2a transforms to the higher dimensional structure when the same mother solution is left undisturbed for at least six months. The new transformed complex 2b adopts a 2-D polymeric array with the formula [AgL(ClO4)] n (Figure ). The asymmetric unit of 2b contains one L, one Ag atom, and one perchlorate ion. The 2-D network of 2b is made up of 1-D coordination polymers with [AgL] repeating units along the c-direction and joined by ClO4 − anions along the b-direction. Basically, the Ag-(μ-ClO4)2-Ag rhomboid core is bonded to four different ligands via Ag−S bonds. The gross geometry of 2b can be described as an infinite square-grid pattern. Similar to the geometry of Ag2 in 1, the Ag atom in 2b is tetrahedrally coordinated by two S-donors from two adjacent macrocycles. The coordination of Ag atom is completed by doubly linked two ClO4 − ions in a monodentate manner. As a consequence, the silver perchlorate complex of L is readily stabilized by forming a 2-D coordination polymer structure that uses the two S donors from each L to adopt a favored tetrahedral geometry with higher symmetry.
elements.clean_text: Very interestingly, we found that the crystalline complex 2a transforms to the higher dimensional structure when the same mother solution is left undisturbed for at least six months. The new transformed complex 2b adopts a 2-D polymeric array with the formula [AgL(ClO4)] n  (Figure ). The asymmetric unit of 2b contains one L, one Ag atom, and one perchlorate ion. The 2-D network of 2b is made up of 1-D coordination polymers with [AgL] repeating units along the c-direction and joined by ClO4 - anions along the b-direction. Basically, the Ag-(μ-ClO4)2-Ag rhomboid core is bonded to four different ligands via Ag-S bonds. The gross geometry of 2b can be described as an infinite square-grid pattern. Similar to the geometry of Ag2 in 1, the Ag atom in 2b is tetrahedrally coordinated by two S-donors from two adjacent macrocycles. The coordination of Ag atom is completed by doubly linked two ClO4 - ions in a monodentate manner. As a consequence, the silver perchlorate complex of L is readily stabilized by forming a 2-D coordination polymer structure that uses the two S donors from each L to adopt a favored tetrahedral geometry with higher symmetry.

elements.content: Crystal structure of 2b, [AgL(ClO4)] n ; (a) core Ag2 L 2(ClO4)2 unit and (b) 2-D square-grid network.
elements.clean_text: 3  Crystal structure of 2b, [AgL(ClO4)] n ; (a) core Ag2 L 2(ClO4)2 unit and (b) 2-D square-grid network.

elements.content: The unpredicted slow conversion of 2a into 2b in mother solution may be understood due to transformation of kinetic to thermodynamic product. The removal of one coordinated acetonitrile appears to initiate the substitution of anion to the coordination sphere. In this case, the preference for the 2-D polymeric scaffold is probably due to the flexible nature of L together with the packing mode because the packing pattern of 2a, having less symmetric solvent molecule acetonitrile, is not of the type observed for the more symmetric anion-containing 1 and 2b. The reaction mixture of 1 was also monitored at room temperature to see whether transformation can occur to 2b, but no change was observed, suggesting 1 could be a thermodynamic product.
elements.clean_text: The unpredicted slow conversion of 2a into 2b in mother solution may be understood due to transformation of kinetic to thermodynamic product. The removal of one coordinated acetonitrile appears to initiate the substitution of anion to the coordination sphere. In this case, the preference for the 2-D polymeric scaffold is probably due to the flexible nature of L together with the packing mode because the packing pattern of 2a, having less symmetric solvent molecule acetonitrile, is not of the type observed for the more symmetric anion-containing 1 and 2b. The reaction mixture of 1 was also monitored at room temperature to see whether transformation can occur to 2b, but no change was observed, suggesting 1 could be a thermodynamic product.

elements.content: In summary, the self-assembly of the dibenzo-O2S2 macrocycle L with silver(I) perchlorate provides a facile means of generating solvent-dependent 1-D polymeric species 1 and 2a with different shapes and coordination environments. The polymeric cation in 2a has an interesting “half-cut tube” structure encasing ClO4 − in its channel. Furthermore, the solvent-mediated transformation from 1-D (2a) to 2-D (2b) species was observed, which is an interesting example of kinetic to thermodynamic-controlled products. From these results, it is concluded that a combination of the coordinating ability of anion and solvent for the soft metal centers coupled with the tendency for the exocoordination of sulfur donors of the thiamacrocycle is important to determine the final structures of the respective complexes.
elements.clean_text: In summary, the self-assembly of the dibenzo-O2S2 macrocycle L with silver(I) perchlorate provides a facile means of generating solvent-dependent 1-D polymeric species 1 and 2a with different shapes and coordination environments. The polymeric cation in 2a has an interesting "half-cut tube" structure encasing ClO4 - in its channel. Furthermore, the solvent-mediated transformation from 1-D (2a) to 2-D (2b) species was observed, which is an interesting example of kinetic to thermodynamic-controlled products. From these results, it is concluded that a combination of the coordinating ability of anion and solvent for the soft metal centers coupled with the tendency for the exocoordination of sulfur donors of the thiamacrocycle is important to determine the final structures of the respective complexes.

metadata.title: Solvent-Dependent Networking of O2S2-Macrocycle with Silver Perchlorate into One- and Two-Dimensional Coordination Polymers
